title: Daniel Zacher
text:
Daniel Zacher (born 4 November 1988 in <a href="Dresden">Dresden</a>) is a German former <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Career.
Zacher played as a youth and reserve for his hometown club, <a href="Dynamo%20Dresden">Dynamo Dresden</a>, before joining <a href="SV%20Babelsberg%2003">SV Babelsberg 03</a> in 2008. He initially served as understudy to <a href="Marian%20Unger">Marian Unger</a>, as the club rose from the <a href="Regionalliga%20Nord">Regionalliga Nord</a> to the <a href="3.%20Liga">3. Liga</a>, but managed 17 appearances in the 2011–12 season and was given the number 1 shirt after Unger left the club in 2012. However, with the arrival of <a href="Frederic%20L%C3%B6he">Frederic Löhe</a>, he found himself on the substitutes bench once again, and left the club in January 2013, retiring from the game shortly after.
